@graph.headline: Does my Australian IP work overseas? - IP First Response
@graph.creditText: IP First Response initiative led by IP Australia

audience.audienceType: Small and medium businesses, startups, and individuals

@graph.usageInfo: This information is general in nature and should not be relied upon as legal advice. You should seek independent professional advice relevant to your specific circumstances.

@graph.headline: Does my Australian IP work overseas?
@graph.articleBody:
Australian registration protects the relevant IP right within Australia. When you register a trade mark, patent, design or plant breeder's right with IP Australia, protection applies only inside Australia. 

If you want exclusive rights in other countries, you can apply in each country or use an international filing system that covers multiple countries. For more information, see: Can I protect my ideas in other countries? | IP Australia First Response. 

Costs, rules and review processes differ between countries. Some people choose to get help from a registered patent or trade mark attorney familiar with the overseas market.

@graph.name: What is it?
@graph.text:
**Australian registration protects the relevant IP right within Australia.** When you register a trade mark, patent, design or plant breeder's right with IP Australia, protection applies only inside Australia. 

If you want exclusive rights in other countries, you can apply in each country or use an international filing system that covers multiple countries. For more information, see: [Can I protect my ideas in other countries? | IP Australia First Response](https://ipfirstresponse.ipaustralia.gov.au/options/can-i-protect-my-ideas-other-countries). 

Costs, rules and review processes differ between countries. Some people choose to get help from a registered patent or trade mark attorney familiar with the overseas market.
